SENT.plain: There are many reports that obstructive sleep apnea syndrome (OSAS) is a risk factor for ischemic stroke of arterial origin, however, the relationship between OSAS and cerebral venous thrombosis (CVT) remains unknown
We report the case of a 44-year-old man who had episodic headaches, unconsciousness attacks and seizures
He was obese and had severe OSAS
Noninvasive continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) therapy prevented the recurrence of CVT as well as of headache
OSAS may be one of the multiple risk factors of CVT as well as arterial ischemic stroke
